name: TeleportHQ
description: TeleportHQ is a low-code platform for building responsive websites and UI components with AI-driven design and code export capabilities.
longDescription: TeleportHQ is a collaborative front-end development platform designed to simplify the creation of responsive websites and UI components through a visual builder and AI-powered tools. It enables designers and developers to work together seamlessly, converting designs from tools like Figma into clean, production-ready code in frameworks like React, Vue, and Next.js. The platform supports rapid prototyping, real-time collaboration, and integration with headless CMS systems, making it ideal for teams aiming to streamline web development. By leveraging AI, TeleportHQ automates website generation from simple text prompts, enhancing speed and flexibility. Its mission is to reduce the complexity of building user interfaces for web and mobile, empowering both technical and non-technical users. The platform also offers open-source code generators, fostering a community-driven approach to development.
features: The AI website generator creates responsive layouts from ChatGPT prompts, enabling rapid website creation without coding expertise.
The drag-and-drop visual editor allows users to build and customize websites intuitively, streamlining the design process.
Code export functionality generates clean HTML, CSS, and JavaScript code in frameworks like React, Vue, Next.js, and Angular.
Figma integration converts designs into responsive websites or components, bridging the gap between design and development.
Real-time collaboration tools enable designers and developers to work together seamlessly on projects.
Responsive templates provide pre-built, customizable website designs optimized for various devices.
Headless CMS integrations allow users to manage content efficiently across multiple platforms.
The global styleguide ensures brand consistency by organizing colors, fonts, and components across projects.
Smart Media Queries simplify responsive design by adapting layouts to different device types and sizes.
Free subdomain hosting lets users publish projects without needing a custom domain.
Custom font uploads maintain design consistency by allowing users to import their own fonts.
Component libraries enable teams to create and reuse UI components across multiple projects.
AI-assisted text editing refines website content using prompts and prebuilt editing options.

faqs.question: What is TeleportHQ used for?
faqs.answer: TeleportHQ is used for building responsive websites and UI components through a visual builder, AI-driven tools, and code export features, ideal for collaborative front-end development.

faqs.question: Does TeleportHQ offer a free plan?
faqs.answer: Yes, TeleportHQ offers a free plan that includes building and publishing one project, real-time collaboration, and access to templates and code export.

faqs.question: Can I export code from TeleportHQ?
faqs.answer: Yes, TeleportHQ allows users to export clean, production-ready code in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript frameworks like React, Vue, and Next.js.

faqs.question: How does the AI website builder work?
faqs.answer: Users input a text prompt via ChatGPT, and the AI generates a responsive website layout, which can be edited in the visual editor or exported as code.

faqs.question: Can I integrate my Figma designs with TeleportHQ?
faqs.answer: Yes, TeleportHQâ€™s Figma plugin allows users to import designs and convert them into responsive websites or components instantly.

faqs.question: Is TeleportHQ suitable for non-coders?
faqs.answer: Absolutely, its drag-and-drop interface and AI tools make it accessible for non-coders to create professional websites with minimal effort.

faqs.question: Does TeleportHQ support team collaboration?
faqs.answer: Yes, real-time collaboration features allow designers and developers to work together on projects, streamlining the development process.

faqs.question: Can I host my website with TeleportHQ?
faqs.answer: TeleportHQ offers free subdomain hosting, with the option to move projects to custom domains for more flexibility.
